parameters:
SubStr(VariableString(HasilStrip), 0, Variable(posisiHuruf)*4) 
+ VariableString(hurufTerpilih) + "   "
+ SubStr(VariableString(HasilStrip), Variable(posisiHuruf)*4 + 4, StrLength(VariableString(HasilStrip)))

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ButtonStates
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Use any object as a button and change appearance according to user interactions.
description: Use the "Button states" behavior to track user interactions with an object, including:
- Hovered
- Pressed
- Clicked
- Idle
Add additional behaviors to make juicy buttons with animated responses to user input:
- Size
- Color
- Animation
- Object effects

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PixelPerfectMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Grid-based or pixel perfect platformer and top-down movements.
description: Games with pixel art usually use pixels bigger than actual pixels of the screen. This can lead to big pixels partially overlapping each other which doesn't look good.
This extension allows to seamlessly keep big pixels aligned when the object is stopped and still beneficiate from the high resolution of the screen to have smooth movements.
It can be used for:
* Pixel-perfect platformers ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer-with-tilemap))
* Align top-down characters on a grid ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-grid-movement))

eventsFunctions.description: Return the speed necessary to cover a distance according to the deceleration.
eventsFunctions.name: SpeedToReach
eventsFunctions.sentence: Braking distance from an initial speed: _PARAM2_ and a deceleration: _PARAM3_ is less than _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Return the braking distance according to an initial speed and a deceleration.
eventsFunctions.name: BrakingDistance
eventsFunctions.sentence: Braking distance from an initial speed: _PARAM2_ and a deceleration: _PARAM3_ is less than _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Define JavaScript classes for top-down.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineJavaScriptForTopDown

inlineCode: * Return the direction to use instead of the direction given in
// Forbid to turn before being aligned on the grid.
// Ensure sharp turn even with Verlet integrations.
* Called before the acceleration and new direction is applied to the
// Find where the deceleration should stop the object.
// Find where the deceleration should stop the object.
// Make as if the player had press button a bit longer to reach exactly
// The velocity is exact. There no need for Verlet integration.
// The velocity is exact. There no need for Verlet integration.
* Called before the velocity is applied to the object position and
// The velocity is exact. There no need for Verlet integration.
// The velocity is exact. There no need for Verlet integration.
// Avoid rounding errors after a call to "separate" to make characters
// move indefinitely in front of a wall because they can't reach the cell.
* @returns {number} the braking distance according to an initial speed and a deceleration.
* @returns {number} the braking distance according to an initial speed and a deceleration.
* @returns {number} the speed necessary to cover a distance according to the deceleration.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Seamlessly align big pixels using a top-down movement.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: PixelPerfectTopDownMovement

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Seamlessly align big pixels using a 2D platformer character movement.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: PixelPerfectPlatformerCharacter

events.comment: We don't know if the deceleration was already applied or not this step, but if the speed drifted from more than 1%, another extension is probably modifying the speed and it must not be overridden.
Find how far to go to reach a pixel.
Move to the target as the movement behavior would do.
Find how far to go to reach a pixel.
Move to the target as the movement behavior would do.

Check if the character is decelerating.
It's done in doStepPostEvent because there is no way to know if the doStepPreEvents of this behavior is executed before or after the one of PlatformerCharcter.
As TimeDelta is used, we have to be sure the last PlatformerCharcter.doStepPreEvents call used the same TimeDelta. Which means this must be done after PlatformerCharcter.doStepPreEvents.
Save the speed to detect speed changes from outside.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (tristan@victrisgames.com), Entropy
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ScreenWrap
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Teleport object when it moves off the screen and immediately appear on the opposite side while maintaining speed and trajectory.
description: The teleport happens when the center point of the object crosses a border (this can be adjusted with an offset).
By default, the borders of the wrapping area match the screen size, but they can also be changed.
The Asteroid-like example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://space-asteroids)).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/) and Entropy (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UClvkb12nOWFgWnQ56NF9Rcw)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShadowClones
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Create and animate shadow clones that follow the path of a primary object.
description: Select the primary object, the shadow clone object, the number of shadow clones, the number of frames between shadow clones, the rate that shadow clones will reduce opacity and size (if desired), the Z-value and the layer the shadow clones will be created on.
This extension can be used to:
- Make an object look faster, such as during a speed powerup.
- Give a 3D-like feel to a character
- Implement unique time-based elements, like teleporting a character back to a previous location
- Simulate the movement of a caterpillar or slinky
- Recreate games like snake or tron
These object variables are provided to manage the shadow clones:
- ShadowCloneOrder: Shadow clone identifier, where 1 is the shadow clone closest to the primary object
- FramesBehindPrimary: The number of frames that the shadow clone is behind the primary object
Notes:
- For shadow clones to work, this action must be run every frame.
- The ShadowCloneObject cannot be the PrimaryObject, but it can be a duplicate object.
- For animations to work, the PrimaryObject and ShadowCloneObject must use the same animation numbers.
Watch this [tutorial video](https://youtu.be/2t4ANYgrrak) to see examples of how to use this extension.

eventsFunctions.description: Select the primary object, the shadow clone object, the number of shadow clones, the number of frames between shadow clones, the rate that shadow clones will fade away (if desired), the Z-value of the shadow clones, and the layer the shadow clones will be created on.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Animate shadow clones that follow the path of a primary object
eventsFunctions.name: AnimateShadowClones
eventsFunctions.sentence: Create and animate _PARAM3_ copies of _PARAM2_ that follow the position of _PARAM1_, with _PARAM4_ empty frames between shadow clones, and fading the opacity of shadow clones by _PARAM5_ per clone.  Shrink scale of shadow clones by _PARAM6_ per clone. Shadow clones will be created on _PARAM7_ layer with a Z-value of _PARAM8_.  Match X scale: _PARAM9_  Match Y scale: _PARAM10_  Match angle: _PARAM11_  Match animation: _PARAM12_  Match animation frame: _PARAM13_  Match vertical flip: _PARAM14_ Match horizontal flip: _PARAM15_

events.comment: Read input variables
Fix default value (min=1)
Calculate the max frames behind the primary that a shadow will exist
Create the right number of shadow clones (but only when there is position data)
Create shadow clones and link them to the primary object

Clean-up unused history
Reset temp variable for iterating through child objects
Move position history to the next higher index, starting from the highest number (FramesBehind-1)
Move object history to one higher frame
Record new current position in index = 1

Fix default value (min=1)
Calculate the max frames behind the primary that a shadow will exist
Create the right number of shadows
Create shadow clones at proper intervals and link them to the primary object

Only change scale if ShrinkSpeed has not been set
Update FramesBehindPrimary if the FramesBetweenShadowClones has changed
Delete shadow clone if we have decreased number of shadow clones or changed distance between clones.  Reset counter variable.
Don't let counter go negative
Don't let counter go negative

Set scale

Move position history to the next higher index, starting from the highest number (FramesBehind-1)
Move object history to one higher frame
Record new current position in index = 1

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Manage health (life) points, shield and armor.
description: Manage health (life) points, shield and armor of instances of an object.
It handles:
- Damage cooldown
- Health and shield regeneration
- Over healing
It can be used on:
- Players
- Enemies
- NPCs
- Inanimate objects (for insance breakable doors or mining rocks)
The top-down RPG example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Manage health (life) points, shield and armor.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Health

No damage will be applied when dodged
If shield is active, damage the shield first
If damage is less than shield, subtract damage from shield.
If damage is greater than shield, conditionally apply excess damage based on property
Apply excess damage only if shield does not block excess damage

eventsFunctions.sentence: the time since last taken hit on health

eventsFunctions.description: the health damage taken from most recent hit.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Health damage taken from most recent hit
eventsFunctions.name: PreviousDamageTaken
eventsFunctions.sentence: the health damage taken from most recent hit

eventsFunctions.description: the maximum shield points of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: MaxShield

eventsFunctions.description: Change the maximum shield points of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: SetMaxShield
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the maximum shield of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points

eventsFunctions.description: Change maximum shield points.
eventsFunctions.name: SetMaxShieldPoints
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the maximum shield points on _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points

eventsFunctions.description: the current shield points of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: ShieldPoints

eventsFunctions.description: Change current shield points. Will not trigger damage cooldown.
eventsFunctions.name: SetShieldPoints
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change current shield points on _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points

eventsFunctions.description: the rate of shield regeneration (points per second).
eventsFunctions.name: ShieldRegenRate

eventsFunctions.description: Change rate of shield regeneration.
eventsFunctions.name: SetShieldRegenRate
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the shield regeneration rate of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points per second

eventsFunctions.description: the delay before shield regeneration starts after being hit (seconds).
eventsFunctions.name: ShieldRegenDelay

eventsFunctions.description: Change delay before shield regeneration starts after being hit.
eventsFunctions.name: SetShieldRegenDelay
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the shield regeneration delay on _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ seconds

eventsFunctions.description: the duration of the shield (seconds). A value of "0" means the shield is permanent.
eventsFunctions.name: ShieldDuration

eventsFunctions.description: Change duration of shield. Use "0" to make shield permanent.
eventsFunctions.name: SetShieldDuration
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the duration of shield on _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ seconds

eventsFunctions.description: Renew shield duration to it's full value.
eventsFunctions.name: RenewShieldDuration

eventsFunctions.description: Activate the shield by setting the shield points and renewing the shield duration (optional).
eventsFunctions.name: ActivateShield
eventsFunctions.sentence: Activate the shield on _PARAM0_ with _PARAM2_ points (Renew shield duration: _PARAM3_)

eventsFunctions.description: Enable (or disable) blocking excess damage when shield breaks.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Block excess damage when shield breaks
eventsFunctions.name: SetShieldBlockExcessDamage
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shield on _PARAM0_ blocks excess damage when it breaks: _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the shield was just damaged previously in the events.
eventsFunctions.name: IsShieldJustDamaged
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shield on _PARAM0_ has just been damaged

eventsFunctions.description: Check if incoming damage was just dodged.
eventsFunctions.name: IsJustDodged

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the shield is active (based on shield points and duration).
eventsFunctions.name: IsShieldActive

events.comment: To be considered "active", a shield must have positive points AND not exceed duration
Don't check the timer when duration is zero (or negative)

eventsFunctions.description: the time before the shield duration ends (seconds).
eventsFunctions.name: ShieldTimeRemaining
eventsFunctions.sentence: the time before the shield duration end

eventsFunctions.description: the shield damage taken from most recent hit.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Shield damage taken from most recent hit
eventsFunctions.name: PreviousDamageToShield
eventsFunctions.sentence: the shield damage taken from most recent hit

eventsFunctions.description: the health points gained from previous heal.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Health points gained from previous heal
eventsFunctions.name: PreviousHealAmount
eventsFunctions.sentence: the health points gained from previous heal

propertyDescriptors.label: Maximum health
propertyDescriptors.description: Use 0 for no maximum.
propertyDescriptors.name: MaxHealth

propertyDescriptors.label: Allow heals to increase health above max health (regen will never exceed max health)
propertyDescriptors.name: AllowOverHealing

propertyDescriptors.label: Damage to health from the previous incoming damage
propertyDescriptors.name: DamageToBeApplied

propertyDescriptors.label: Chance to dodge incoming damage (between 0 and 1)
propertyDescriptors.description: When a damage is dodged, no damage is applied.
propertyDescriptors.name: ChanceToDodge

propertyDescriptors.label: Health points gained from the previous heal
propertyDescriptors.name: HealToBeApplied

propertyDescriptors.label: Rate of health regeneration (points per second)
propertyDescriptors.name: HealthRegenRate

propertyDescriptors.label: Health regeneration delay
propertyDescriptors.description: Delay before health regeneration starts after a hit.
propertyDescriptors.name: HealthRegenDelay

propertyDescriptors.label: Maximum shield
propertyDescriptors.description: Leave 0 for unlimited.
propertyDescriptors.name: MaxShieldPoints

propertyDescriptors.label: Duration of shield
propertyDescriptors.description: Use 0 to make the shield permanent.
propertyDescriptors.name: ShieldDuration

propertyDescriptors.label: Rate of shield regeneration (points per second)
propertyDescriptors.name: ShieldRegenRate

propertyDescriptors.label: Block excess damage when shield is broken
propertyDescriptors.name: BlockExcessDamage

propertyDescriptors.label: Shield regeneration delay
propertyDescriptors.description: Delay before shield regeneration starts after a hit.
propertyDescriptors.name: ShieldRegenDelay

propertyDescriptors.label: Damage to shield from the previous incoming damage
propertyDescriptors.name: ShieldDamageTaken

propertyDescriptors.label: Flat damage reduction from armor
propertyDescriptors.description: Incoming damages are reduced by this value.
propertyDescriptors.name: FlatDamageReduction

propertyDescriptors.label: Percentage damage reduction from armor (between 0 and 1)
propertyDescriptors.name: PercentDamageReduction

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: JSONResourceLoader
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Loads a JSON resource into a variable.
description: Loads a (static) JSON resource from your project files into a global, scene, or object variable.
NEVER use this to load your game.json into a variable - this would increase your game size by a lot and make your whole project file available for anyone to open!

eventsFunctions.description: Loads a JSON resource into a scene structure variable.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Load a JSON resource in a scene variable
eventsFunctions.name: LoadJSONToScene

parameters.description: The resource to load the JSON from
parameters.name: Resource

parameters.description: The scene variable to load the JSON to
parameters.name: Variable

eventsFunctions.description: Loads a JSON resource into a global structure variable.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Load a JSON resource in a global variable
eventsFunctions.name: LoadJSONToGlobal

parameters.description: The resource to load the JSON from
parameters.name: Resource

parameters.description: The global variable to load the JSON to
parameters.name: Variable

eventsFunctions.description: Loads a JSON resource into an object structure variable.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Load a JSON resource in an object variable
eventsFunctions.name: LoadJSONToObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Load _PARAM1_ into object variable _PARAM3_ of object _PARAM2_

parameters.description: The resource to load the JSON from
parameters.name: Resource

parameters.description: The object where to find the variable
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: The object variable to load the JSON to
parameters.name: Variable
